text: Remove certain consecutive duplicates in list
I have a list of strings like this:
I want to replace the '**', '**' with a single '**', but leave 'bar', 'bar' intact.
replace any consecutive number of '**' with a single one.
My current code looks like this:

code:
p = ['**', 'foo', '*', 'bar', 'bar', '**', '**', 'baz']
np = [p[0]]
for pi in range(1,len(p)):
  if p[pi] == '**' and np[-1] == '**':
    continue
  np.append(p[pi])

text: Is there any more pythonic way to do this?
